concept.title: Shadow DOM
concept.shortdesc: This project demonstrates how helps users to automate applications behind the shadow DOM. It contains some test cases for the shadow DOM.

conbody.p: Shadow DOM allows hidden DOM trees to be attached to elements in the regular DOM tree.

The usual way of finding an element with Katalon Studio using Locators will throw NoSuchElementException. And if you look at the DOM structure, every element that has shadowDOM also has a shadowRoot property which describes the underlying element. Shadow DOM provides encapsulation for the JavaScript, CSS, and templating in a Web Component.

Shadow host refers to the regular DOM node that the shadow DOM is attached to. Shadow tree refers to the DOM tree inside the shadow DOM. Shadow boundary refers to the place where the shadow DOM ends, and the regular DOM begins. Shadow Root refers to the root node of the shadow tree.
